newsitem.title: CUBA: Grenada prime minister visits Cuba.
newsitem.headline: Grenada prime minister visits Cuba.

text.p: Cuban President Fidel Castro met Grenada Prime Minister Keith Mitchell at Havana airport on Saturday at the start of a five-day visit to the communist-ruled island aimed at fostering better ties.
Castro and Mitchell greeted each other on the airport tarmac but did not speak to reporters.
The Cuban official news agency Prensa Latina said Mitchell's visit represented a chance for Cuba and Grenada to boost links after setbacks in recent years.

The Foreign Ministry said earlier this week Mitchell would cover a wide range of issues, including possible future economic cooperation, during talks with Cuban officials. Mitchell, whose country is currently secretary-general of the Association of Caribbean States, is set to hold formal talks with Castro on Monday.
The Grenada premier was also due to meet Foreign Minister Roberto Robaina, Tourism Minister Osmany Cienfuegos and Trade Minister Ricardo Cabrisas.

Mitchell is the first senior Grenada official to visit Cuba since leftist leader Maurice Bishop in 1983. Bishop had strong ties with Cuba until his arrest and excution during a political crisis in October 1983. The crisis triggered the U.S. military invasion of Grenada later in October 1983.
